messages.content: שרה שרה שיר שמח. איזה שיר שרה שרה?
I'm sorry, but I am unable to recall the name of the poem you are referring to. Can you please provide more context or details about the poem in question?

The question of when and how the Messiah will come is a topic of much discussion and debate among Jews and Christians. Some believe that he will come in the future, while others hold that prophecies about the Messiah have already been fulfilled in the past.

In Judaism, the Messiah is often seen as a figure who will bring about the ultimate redemption and restoration of the world to its original state. According to some interpretations, the Messiah will come at the end of the current age, and will bring about a time of peace, prosperity, and justice for all people.

However, there is much disagreement about the specific details of the Messiah's coming, as well as when and how it will occur. Some believe that the Messiah will come suddenly and unexpectedly, while others hold that prophecies about the Messiah have already been fulfilled in the past.

It's also worth noting that there are different views about the Messiah's role and nature, and some Jewish scholars believe that the Messiah has already come and that his coming was not in the way we might have expected.

Overall, the question of when and how the Messiah will come is a complex and much debated topic, and there are many different perspectives on the subject within Judaism and beyond.
